bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harvey E. Jordan, September 19, 1940

div1.p: Hench writes that he hopes Jordan will be able to invite Moran to visit the University of Virginia.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Harvey E. Jordan, September 19, 1940
div1.opener:
September 19, 1940
Dean Harvey E. Jordan
University of Virginia
Charlottesville, Virginia
My dear Dean Jordan:
div1.p:
Last Spring, having visited Mr. Moran in Havana, later I stopped to
visit my brother at the University of Virginia. You probably know him--Dr.
A. L. Hench of the Department of English Literature. When I was in Havana
for ten days with Mr. Moran, every now and then he would wistfully refer to
the University of Virginia and say how anxious he was to visit it sometime.
He told me that he had been invited especially once before, but had been
unable to attend. I told Mr. Clemons that on October 25 and 26, Mr. Moran
was to be invited to be a special guest on the occasion of the dedication
of the Lazear Memorial Building at Washington and Jefferson College, Wash-
ington, Pennsylvania, and suggested that perhaps Mr. Moran might be able to
visit Charlottesville before or after that occasion.

In a letter just received from Mr. Moran, he tells me that he feels
that he has to decline, more for financial than personal reasons, but also
because he hesitates taking the time off from his work. As you will see, Mr.
Pew is apparently not only delighted for him to take the time off, but will
pay his expenses. Therefore, I sincerely hope that you will be able to re-
invite him, and as you will note, since they want him at Washington, Pennsylvania
by Friday evening, October 25, I hope that his visit to Charlottesville can
be arranged so that he can get to Pittsburgh in plenty of time.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
